content:
Diagnosis:
Follicular thyroid carcinoma

Surgery:
Total thyroidectomy 15 March 2024 - Dr [redacted name]

Histology:
Minimally invasive follicular thyroid carcinoma
pT2N0M0 (AJCC 8th Edition)
No vascular invasion
Complete excision

Previous medical history:
None of note

Current medications:
Levothyroxine 125mcg daily

Current situation:
Post-operative review and completion of radioactive iodine ablation

I reviewed [redacted name] today following completion of radioactive iodine ablation therapy. The treatment was well tolerated with only mild temporary symptoms of dry mouth and slight nausea which have now resolved. Thyroglobulin levels have appropriately decreased post ablation from 4.2 to 0.8. TSH is well suppressed at <0.01 on current levothyroxine dose.

Examination shows well-healed thyroidectomy scar. No cervical lymphadenopathy. Performance status 0.

Post-treatment whole body scan shows no evidence of residual thyroid tissue or metastatic disease. The plan is for ongoing TSH suppression with current levothyroxine dose and surveillance with 6-monthly thyroglobulin measurements. Next clinic review will be in 6 months with thyroid function tests and thyroglobulin level. Annual neck ultrasound will be arranged.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: Minimally invasive follicular thyroid carcinoma, no vascular invasion, complete excision

cancer_timeline.value: Total thyroidectomy performed by Dr [redacted name]
Post-ablation thyroglobulin decreased to 0.8, TSH well suppressed at <0.01
Post-treatment whole body scan shows no evidence of residual thyroid tissue or metastatic disease

patient_facts.value: Well-healed thyroidectomy scar, no cervical lymphadenopathy

status_updates.value: Stage I follicular thyroid carcinoma treated with total thyroidectomy and radioactive iodine ablation. Good response to treatment with appropriate biochemical markers
Mild temporary symptoms of dry mouth and slight nausea during radioactive iodine ablation, now resolved
Continuing levothyroxine 125mcg daily for TSH suppression
6-monthly thyroglobulin measurements and annual neck ultrasound
Clinic review in 6 months with thyroid function tests and thyroglobulin level
